alert.note: Alert for Maury; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Rutherford, northeastern Maury and eastern Williamson Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 159 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Spring Hill, or 10 miles northeast of Columbia, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Columbia, Brentwood, Spring Hill, Nolensville, Thompson`s Station, Eagleville and Triune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 48 and 66. Interstate 840 between mile markers 24 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
